analyzed: suññā maññe aṅgamagadhāḥ aṅgamāgadhakehi paricārakehi abbhatītehi kālaṅkatehi
translated: It seems to me that Aṅga and Magadha are empty, with few people and few chores.”

original: Te kho panāpi, bhante, ahesuṁ buddhe pasannā dhamme pasannā saṅghe pasannā sīlesu paripūrakārino, te abbhatītā kālaṅkatā bhagavatā abyākatā.
analyzed: te kho pana api bhante ahesum buddhe pasannāḥ dhamme pasannā saṅghe pasannā sīlesu paripūra kārinaḥ te abbhatītā kālaṅkatā bhagavatā abyākatā
translated: “But, Lord, they too had faith in the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha, and they had fulfilled their virtue. The Buddha hasn’t declared their destinations.

original: Tesampissa sādhu veyyākaraṇaṁ, bahujano pasīdeyya, tato gaccheyya sugatiṁ.
analyzed: tesam pissa sādhu veyyākaraṇa bahu janaḥ pasīdeyya tatas gaccheyya sugati
translated: It would be good if you would explain their destinations, for many people would gain confidence.”

analyzed: ayam kho pana api bhante ahosi rājā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ dhammikaḥ dhamma rājā hitaḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikānam negamānam ca iva jānapadānam ca
translated: “But, Lord, King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha was a righteous king who ruled by the Dhamma, and he was a benefactor and supporter of the brahmins and householders in town and country.

original: Apissudaṁ manussā kittayamānarūpā viharanti:

translated: People even used to say of him:

analyzed: saḥ kho pana api bhante ahosi buddhe pasannaḥ dhamme pasanno saṅghe pasanno sīlesu paripūra kārī

original: Apissudaṁ manussā evamāhaṁsu:

translated: People might say:

analyzed: yāva maraṇa kālā api rājā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ bhagavantam kittayamāna rūpaḥ
translated: ‘Even at the time of his death, the Magadhan King Seniya Bimbisāra was praising the Blessed One.’

original: So abbhatīto kālaṅkato bhagavatā abyākato;

translated: He has passed away and died, but the Blessed One has not declared his destination.

original: Bhagavato kho pana, bhante, sambodhi magadhesu.

translated: Since the Blessed One’s awakening was in Magadha, why wouldn’t the Blessed One declare the rebirths of his Magadhan supporters who have passed away and died?

original: Bhagavā ce kho pana, bhante, māgadhake paricārake abbhatīte kālaṅkate upapattīsu na byākareyya, dīnamanā tenassu māgadhakā paricārakā;
analyzed: bhagavā ce kho pana bhante māgadhake paricārake abbhatīte kālaṅkate upapattīsu na byākareyya dīna manāḥ māgadhakāḥ paricārakāḥ
translated: If the Blessed One doesn’t declare the rebirths of his Magadhan supporters who have passed away and died, the Magadhan supporters will be dejected.

analyzed: idam āyasmai ānandaḥ māgadhake paricārake ārabbha bhagavatoḥ sammukhā parikatham katvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi  atha kho bhagavā acira pakkante āyasmante ānande pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya na atikam piṇḍāya pāvisi

original: Nātike piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto pāde pakkhāletvā giñjakāvasathaṁ

analyzed: pavisitvā māgadhake paricārake ārabbha aṭṭhim katvā manasikatvā sabbam cetasā samannāharitvā

original: paññatte āsane nisīdi:

translated: He then sat down on a seat made ready and said:

translated: “I know their destiny, their future course.”

analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Soon afterwards Venerable Ānanda went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

translated: Did you spend the day in a pleasant way?”

analyzed: yat eva khalu me tvam ānanda māgadhake paricārake ārabbha sammukhā parikatham katvā  uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkantaḥ tat eva aham na atike piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantaḥ
translated: “Ānanda, after you left me, I went into town for alms. After the meal, on my return from the alms round,

translated: and then sat down on the prepared seat, thinking:

analyzed: gatim na īsam jānissāmi abhisamparāya yaṅgatikā te bhavantaḥ ya abhisamparāyāti
translated: ‘I will find out where they have gone and what their future state will be.’

translated: “No, Lord, I do not remember ever hearing such a name before. But, Lord, my hairs stood on end when I heard the name ‘Janavasabha.’

translated: I am Bimbisāra, Happy One!’

original: Nivāsamabhijānāmi,

analyzed: dīgharattam kho aha bhante a vinipātaḥ a vinipātam sañjānāmi iti ca vadesi āsā  ca pana me santiṭṭhati sakadāgāmi tāya ati ca vadesi kutonidānam pana ayasmai jana vasabho
translated: ‘For a long time, venerable sir, I have known that I am not subject to destruction, but🔽I still have a hope that I shall attain once-return.

translated: ‘Venerable sir, you say: “For a long time I have been one who does not take life, who abstains from taking life,” and you say: “Hope still remains for me that I may become a once-returner.” But what is the reason, venerable sir, that the spirit Janavasabha has attained such a high distinction?”

original: “‘Na aññatra, bhagavā, tava sāsanā, na aññatra, sugata, tava sāsanā;

analyzed: yadagge aha bhante bhagavati ekantikataḥ abhippasanno tadagge aha bhante dīgharattam avinipāto avinipātam sañjānāmi āsā ca pana me santiṭṭhati sakadāgāmi tāya
translated: Venerable sir, as soon as I had full confidence in the Blessed One, then I knew that for a long time I had been one who did not take life, who abstained from taking life, and hope still remained for me that I might become a once-returner.

original: Idhāhaṁ, bhante, vessavaṇena mahārājena pesito virūḷhakassa mahārājassa santike kenacideva
analyzed: idha āha bhante vessavaṇena mahā rājena pesitaḥ virūḷhakassa mahā rājassa santike kenacid eva

translated: I thought: ‘I will know their destination, their future state, wherever those who have passed away have been reborn.’

translated: ‘I will see the Fortunate One, and I will report this matter to the Fortunate One.’

analyzed: ime kho me bhante dvepaccayāḥ bhagavantam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu

analyzed: atha kho bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ tettise attabhāve abhinimminitvā devānam tāvatisānam pacceka pallaṅkesu pallaṅkena nisīditvā deve tāvatise āmantesi
translated: Then Brahmā Sahampati, having created three-hundred-andfifty forms of himself, sat down cross-legged on the various couches of the Thirty-Three Gods, and addressed the gods:

original: “taṁ kiṁ maññanti, bhonto devā tāvatiṁsā, yāvañca so bhagavā bahujanahitāya paṭipanno bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: tam kim maññanti bhonto devā tāvati sā yāvat ca saḥ bhagavā bahu jana hitāya paṭipannaḥ bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: “What do you think, dear Sirs, about the way the Lord has set out for the benefit of the many, for the happiness of the many, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, happiness of devas and humans?🔽Those who have gone to the Buddha for refuge, to the Dhamma and to the Sangha,

original: Ye hi keci, bho, buddhaṁ saraṇaṁ gatā dhammaṁ saraṇaṁ gatā saṅghaṁ saraṇaṁ gatā sīlesu
analyzed: ye hi keci bho buddham saraṇam gatāḥ dhammam saraṇam gatā saṅgham saraṇam gatā sīlesu
translated: and who are perfect in morality,

original: paripūrakārino te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā appekacce paranimmitavasavattīnaṁ devānaṁ
analyzed: paripūra kārinaḥ te kāyassa bhedāḥ param maraṇā appa ekacce paranimmitavasavattīnam devāna
translated: after the break-up of the body, are reborn in a happy state, in the world of the Tusita gods,

original: sahabyataṁ upapajjanti, appekacce nimmānaratīnaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjanti,
analyzed: sahabyatam upapajjanti appekacce nimmānaratīnam devānam sahabyatam upapajjanti
translated: or in the world of the Yāma gods,

original: appekacce tusitānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjanti, appekacce yāmānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ
analyzed: appekacce tusitānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjanti appekacce yāmānam devānam sahabyata
translated: some to be reborn amongst the Tusita gods, some to be reborn amongst the Yāma gods,

original: upapajjanti, appekacce tāvatiṁsānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjanti, appekacce cātumahārājikānaṁ🔽devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjanti.
analyzed: upapajjanti appekacce tāvatisānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjanti appekacce cātumahārājikānam  devānam sahabyatam upapajjanti
translated: some to be reborn amongst the Tāvatiṁsa gods, some to be reborn amongst the Cātummahārājika gods.

original: Ye sabbanihīnaṁ kāyaṁ paripūrenti, te gandhabbakāyaṁ paripūrentī”ti.🔽Imamatthaṁ, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro bhāsittha;
analyzed: ye sabba nihīnam kāyam paripūrenti te gandhabba kāyam paripūrenti iti  imam attha bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ bhāsittha
translated: Those who fill up the lowest body, they fill up the gandhabbakāya.”🔽This is the meaning of what was said, reverend Sir, by Brahmā Sanaṅkumāra,

original: imamatthaṁ, bhante, brahmuno sanaṅkumārassa bhāsato ghosoyeva devā maññanti:
analyzed: imam attha bhante brahmunaḥ sanaṅkumārassa bhāsataḥ devāḥ maññanti
translated: and when this was said, the gods thought:

original: “yvāyaṁ mama pallaṅke svāyaṁ ekova bhāsatī”ti.
analyzed: yvā ayam mama pallaṅke su āyam ekaḥ iva bhāsati iti
translated: “He who is speaking on my seat, he alone is speaking.”

original: Ekasmiṁ bhāsamānasmiṁ,
analyzed: ekasmin bhāsamāna asmi
translated: When one is speaking,

original: sabbe bhāsanti nimmitā;
analyzed: sabbe bhāsanti nimmitā
translated: all the created beings speak;

original: Ekasmiṁ tuṇhimāsīne,
analyzed: ekasmin tuṇhim āsīne
translated: When one is silent,

original: sabbe tuṇhī bhavanti te.
analyzed: sabbe tuṇhī bhavanti te
translated: all are silent.

original: Tadāsu devā maññanti,
analyzed: tat āsu devāḥ maññanti
translated: Then the gods think:

original: tāvatiṁsā sahindakā;
analyzed: tāvatī sā sahindakā
translated: the Tāvatiṁsa gods with their lord,

original: Yvāyaṁ mama pallaṅkasmiṁ,
analyzed: yvā ayam mama
translated: “He who is speaking on my seat,

original: svāyaṁ ekova bhāsatīti.
analyzed: su ayam ekaḥ iva bhāsati iti
translated: he alone is speaking.”

original: Atha kho, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro ekattena attānaṁ upasaṁharati, ekattena attānaṁ upasaṁharitvā sakkassa devānamindassa pallaṅke pallaṅkena nisīditvā deve tāvatiṁse āmantesi:🔽6. Bhāvitaiddhipāda🔽“Taṁ kiṁ maññanti, bhonto devā tāvatiṁsā, yāva supaññattā cime tena bhagavatā jānatā
analyzed: atha kho bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ ekattena attānam upasaharati ekattena attānam upasaharitvā sakkassa devānamindassa pallaṅke pallaṅkena nisīditvā deve tāvatise āmantesi  bhāvita aiddhipāda  tam kim maññanti bhonto devā tāvatisā yāva su paññattā cime tena bhagavatā jānatā
translated: Then, venerable sir, Brahma Sanankumara, having established the company in the Brahma-world in the first jhana, having gone beyond the company in the Brahma-world, having established the company in the second jhana…in the third jhana…in the fourth jhana, addressed them thus:🔽“What do my good friends think?

original: passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena cattāro iddhipādā paññattā iddhipahutāya iddhivisavitāya iddhivikubbanatāya.
analyzed: passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena cattāro iddhipādā paññattā iddhi pahutāya iddhi visavitāya iddhi vikubbana tāya
translated: How well presented by the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, are these four bases for spiritual power, which provide a basis for spiritual power, for attaining distinction in knowledge and vision, for the realization of the fruit of true knowledge and deliverance!

original: Katame cattāro?
analyzed: katame cattāro
translated: What four?

original: Idha bho bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti.🔽Vīriyasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti.🔽Cittasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: idha bho bhikkhu chanda samādhi ppadhāna saṅkhāra samannāgatam iddhipādam bhāveti  vīriya samādhi ppadhāna saṅkhāra samannāgatam iddhipādam bhāveti  citta samādhi ppadhāna saṅkhāra samannāgatam iddhipādam bhāveti
translated: Here, my good friends, a bhikkhu develops the basis for spiritual power that possesses concentration due to desire and volitional formations of striving.🔽He develops the basis for spiritual power that possesses concentration due to energy…🔽concentration due to mind…

original: Vīmaṁsāsamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: vīmasā samādhi ppadhāna saṅkhāra samannāgatam iddhipādam bhāva iti
translated: concentration due to investigation and volitional formations of striving.

original: Ime kho, bho, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena cattāro iddhipādā paññattā iddhipahutāya iddhivisavitāya iddhivikubbanatāya.🔽Ye hi keci bho atītamaddhānaṁ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṁ iddhividhaṁ paccanubhosuṁ, sabbe te imesaṁyeva catunnaṁ iddhipādānaṁ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.
analyzed: ime kho bho tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena cattāro iddhipādā paññattā iddhi pahutāya iddhi visavitāya iddhi vikubbana tāya  ye hi keci bho atīta maddhānam samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā aneka vihitam iddhi vidham sabbe te catunnam iddhipādānam bhāvita ttā bahulīkata ttā
translated: These, friends, are the four roads to power that have been fully explained by the Lord who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened, for the attainment of the various kinds of psychic power.🔽Whatever ascetics or Brahmins in the future will attain the various kinds of psychic power, all will do so by these four roads to power.

original: Yepi hi keci bho anāgatamaddhānaṁ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṁ iddhividhaṁ paccanubhossanti, sabbe te imesaṁyeva catunnaṁ iddhipādānaṁ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.🔽Yepi hi keci bho etarahi samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṁ iddhividhaṁ paccanubhonti, sabbe te imesaṁyeva catunnaṁ iddhipādānaṁ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.
analyzed: ye api hi keci bho anāgata maddhānam samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā aneka vihitam iddhi vidham paccanubhossanti sabbe te catunnam iddhipādānam bhāvita ttā bahulīkata ttā 🔽ye api hi keci bho etarahi samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā aneka vihitam iddhi vidham paccanubhonti sabbe te catunnam iddhipādānam bhāvita ttā bahulīkata ttā
translated: Whatever ascetics or Brahmins in the present attain the various kinds of psychic power, all do so by these four roads to power.🔽And why? Because these four roads to power have been fully explained by the Lord who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened, for the attainment of the various kinds of psychic power.

original: Passanti no, bhonto devā tāvatiṁsā, mamapimaṁ evarūpaṁ iddhānubhāvan”ti?
analyzed: passanti no bhontaḥ devā tāvatisā mama api imam evarūpam iddha anubhāvanti
translated: Do you see, sirs, that I have such power and might?”

original: “Evaṁ, mahābrahme”ti.
analyzed: eva mahā brahmā iti
translated: “Yes, Great Brahmā.”

original: “Ahampi kho bho imesaṁyeva catunnañca iddhipādānaṁ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā evaṁ mahiddhiko evaṁmahānubhāvo”ti.
analyzed: aham pi kho bho catunnam ca iddhipādānam bhāvi tattā bahulīkatattā evam mahiddhikaḥ eva mahā anubhāvaḥ ti
translated: “I too, sirs, have become such by the development and cultivation of the four bases of success.”

original: Imamatthaṁ, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro bhāsittha.
analyzed: imam attha bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ bhāsittha
translated: This is the meaning of what was said by Brahmā Sanankumāra.

original: Imamatthaṁ, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro bhāsitvā deve tāvatiṁse āmantesi:🔽7. Tividhaokāsādhigama
analyzed: imam attha bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ bhāsitvā deve tāvatise āmantesi  tividha okāsa adhigama
translated: Having said this, Brahmā Sanankumāra addressed the Tāvatiṁsa gods thus:

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññanti, bhonto devā tāvatiṁsā, yāvañcidaṁ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena tayo okāsādhigamā anubuddhā sukhassādhigamāya.
analyzed: tam kim maññanti bhonto devā tāvatisā yāvañcidam tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena tayo okāsa adhigamā anubuddhā sukhassa adhigamāya
translated: “What do you think, sirs—hasn’t the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, discovered three instances of receptivity that lead to the attainment of ease?

original: Katame tayo?🔽Idha bho ekacco saṁsaṭṭho viharati kāmehi saṁsaṭṭho akusalehi dhammehi.
analyzed: katame tayaḥ  idha bho ekaccaḥ sasaṭṭhaḥ viharati kāmehi sasaṭṭhaḥ akusalehi dhammehi
translated: What are the three?🔽There is the case where a certain person dwells together with his friends, acquaintances, & relatives. He is devoted to them, sympathetic to them, and committed to them.

original: So aparena samayena ariyadhammaṁ suṇāti, yoniso manasi karoti, dhammānudhammaṁ paṭipajjati.
analyzed: saḥ aparena samayena ariya dhammam suṇāti yonisas manasi karoti dhamma anudhammam paṭipajjati
translated: Later on, he hears a Dhamma talk that is conducive to the arousal of lust. He directs his thought to that talk, and lust invades his mind.

original: So ariyadhammassavanaṁ āgamma yonisomanasikāraṁ dhammānudhammappaṭipattiṁ asaṁsaṭṭho viharati kāmehi asaṁsaṭṭho akusalehi dhammehi.
analyzed: so ariya dhamma ssavanam āgamma yoniso manasikāram dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipattim a sasaṭṭhaḥ viharati kāmehi a sasaṭṭhaḥ akusalehi dhammehi
translated: When he has heard the Dhamma, he practices in accordance with the Dhamma.

original: Tassa asaṁsaṭṭhassa kāmehi asaṁsaṭṭhassa akusalehi dhammehi uppajjati sukhaṁ, sukhā bhiyyo somanassaṁ.
analyzed: tassa a sasaṭṭhassa kāmehi a sasaṭṭhassa akusalehi dhammehi uppajjati sukha sukhā bhiyyo somanassa
translated: When he practices in accordance with the Dhamma, pleasure arises in him. With the arising of pleasure, his mind becomes concentrated.

original: Seyyathāpi, bho, pamudā pāmojjaṁ jāyetha;
analyzed: sā iyyathā api bho pamudā pāmojjam jāyetha
translated: Just as, when rain falls in thick droplets on a mountain top, the water flows down along with the slope,

original: evameva kho, bho, asaṁsaṭṭhassa kāmehi asaṁsaṭṭhassa akusalehi dhammehi uppajjati sukhaṁ, sukhā bhiyyo somanassaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho bho a sasaṭṭhassa kāmehi a sasaṭṭhassa akusalehi dhammehi uppajjati sukha sukhā bhiyyas somanassa
translated: so too, when he practices in accordance with the Dhamma, pleasure arises in him. With the arising of pleasure, his mind becomes concentrated.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bho, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena paṭhamo okāsādhigamo anubuddho sukhassādhigamāya.
analyzed: ayam kho bho tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena paṭhamaḥ okāsa adhigamaḥ anubuddhaḥ sukhassa adhigamāya
translated: This is the first case he has discovered by the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One, for the attainment of Nibbana.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bho, idhekaccassa oḷārikā kāyasaṅkhārā appaṭippassaddhā honti, oḷārikā vacīsaṅkhārā appaṭippassaddhā honti, oḷārikā cittasaṅkhārā appaṭippassaddhā honti.
analyzed: puna capara bho idha ekaccassa oḷārikā kāya saṅkhārāḥ appaṭippassaddhāḥ honti oḷārikāḥ vacī saṅkhārāḥ appaṭippassaddhāḥ honti oḷārikāḥ citta saṅkhārāḥ appaṭippassaddhāḥ honti
translated: “Again, some person’s gross bodily formations are unabandoned and unforgotten, his gross verbal formations are unabandoned and unforgotten, his gross mental formations are unabandoned and unforgotten.

original: So aparena samayena ariyadhammaṁ suṇāti, yoniso manasi karoti, dhammānudhammaṁ paṭipajjati.🔽Tassa ariyadhammassavanaṁ āgamma yonisomanasikāraṁ dhammānudhammappaṭipattiṁ oḷārikā🔽kāyasaṅkhārā paṭippassambhanti, oḷārikā vacīsaṅkhārā paṭippassambhanti, oḷārikā cittasaṅkhārā paṭippassambhanti.
analyzed: saḥ aparena samayena ariya dhammam suṇāti yonisas manasi karoti dhamma anudhammam paṭipajjati  tassa ariya dhamma ssavanam āgamma yoniso manasikāram dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipattim oḷārikā  kāya saṅkhārā paṭippassambhanti oḷārikā vacī saṅkhārā paṭippassambhanti oḷārikā citta saṅkhārā paṭippassambhanti
translated: Then, after some time, he listens to the true Dhamma, directs his thought to it rightly, and conducts himself according to the Dhamma.🔽Then, through his listening to the true Dhamma, directing his thought rightly, and conducting himself according to the Dhamma, his gross bodily, verbal, and mental formations are abandoned,

original: Tassa oḷārikānaṁ kāyasaṅkhārānaṁ paṭippassaddhiyā oḷārikānaṁ vacīsaṅkhārānaṁ paṭippassaddhiyā
analyzed: tassa oḷārikānam kāya saṅkhārānam paṭippassaddhiyāḥ oḷārikānam vacī saṅkhārānam paṭippassaddhiyāḥ
translated: and with the abandoning of the gross bodily, verbal, and mental formations,

original: oḷārikānaṁ cittasaṅkhārānaṁ paṭippassaddhiyā uppajjati sukhaṁ, sukhā bhiyyo somanassaṁ.
analyzed: oḷārikānam citta saṅkhārānam paṭippassaddhiyā uppajjati sukha sukha bhiyyas somanassa
translated: joy arises, and from joy, rapture arises, and with the arising of rapture, the body becomes tranquil, and with the tranquility of the body, he experiences happiness, and with happiness the mind becomes concentrated.

original: Seyyathāpi, bho, pamudā pāmojjaṁ jāyetha;
analyzed: sā iyyathā api bho pamudā pāmojjam jāyetha
translated: Just as, when rain falls in torrents on a mountain top, the water flows down along with the slope and fills the clefts, gullies, and creeks; these being full fill up the pools; these being full fill up the ponds; these being full fill up the streams; these being full fill up the rivers; and these being full fill up the great ocean.

original: evameva kho bho oḷārikānaṁ kāyasaṅkhārānaṁ paṭippassaddhiyā oḷārikānaṁ vacīsaṅkhārānaṁ
analyzed: evam eva kho bho oḷārikānam kāya saṅkhārānam paṭippassaddhiyai oḷārikānam vacī saṅkhārānam
translated: So too, through his listening to the true Dhamma, directing his thought rightly, and conducting himself according to the Dhamma, his gross bodily, verbal, and mental formations are abandoned,🔽and with the abandoning of the gross bodily, verbal, and mental formations,

original: paṭippassaddhiyā oḷārikānaṁ cittasaṅkhārānaṁ paṭippassaddhiyā uppajjati sukhaṁ, sukhā bhiyyo somanassaṁ.
analyzed: paṭippassaddhiyāḥ oḷārikānaṃ citta saṅkhārānaṃ paṭippassaddhiyāḥ uppajjati sukha sukha bhiyyaḥ somanassa
translated: With the stilling of applied and sustained thought, he enters upon and abides in the second jhana, which has internal confidence and unification of mind, is without applied thought, is filled with rapture and joy.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bho, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dutiyo okāsādhigamo anubuddho sukhassādhigamāya.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bho, idhekacco ‘idaṁ kusalan’ti yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti, ‘idaṁ akusalan’ti yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti.🔽‘Idaṁ sāvajjaṁ idaṁ anavajjaṁ, idaṁ sevitabbaṁ idaṁ na sevitabbaṁ, idaṁ hīnaṁ idaṁ paṇītaṁ, idaṁ kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgan’ti yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti.
analyzed: ayam kho bho tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dutiyaḥ okāsa adhigamaḥ anubuddhaḥ sukhassa adhigamāya  puna capara bho idha ekaccaḥ idam kusalanti yathābhūtam na ppajānāti idam akusalanti yathābhūtam na ppajānāti  idam sāvajjam idam anavajje idam sevitabbam idam na sevitabbe idam hīnam idam paṇīte idam kaṇha sukka sappaṭibhāgam ti yathābhūtam na pajānāti
translated: This is the second case in which a person should be directly known as a person of great wisdom.🔽“Again, a certain person does not understand as it really is: ‘This is wholesome, this is unwholesome, this is blamable, this is blameless, this is to be cultivated, this is not to be cultivated, this is not the proper time for that, this is the proper time for that, this is an individual of great wisdom, this is an individual who is not of great wisdom.’

original: So aparena samayena ariyadhammaṁ suṇāti, yoniso manasi karoti, dhammānudhammaṁ paṭipajjati.
analyzed: saḥ aparena samayena ariya dhammam suṇāti yonisas manasi karoti dhamma anudhammam paṭipajjati
translated: But after some time he hears the Dhamma and attends to it well, and then he understands as it really is: ‘This is wholesome, this is unwholesome, this is blamable, this is blameless, this is to be cultivated, this is not to be cultivated, this is not the proper time for that, this is the proper time for that, this is an individual of great wisdom, this is an individual who is not of great wisdom.’

original: So ariyadhammassavanaṁ āgamma yonisomanasikāraṁ dhammānudhammappaṭipattiṁ, ‘idaṁ kusalan’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘idaṁ akusalan’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: saḥ ariya dhamma ssavanam āgamma yoniso manasikāram dhamma anudhamma paṭipatti idam kusalanti yathābhūtam pajānāti idam akusalanti yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: He understands as it really is: ‘This is wholesome, this is unwholesome, this is blamable, this is blameless, this is to be cultivated, this is not to be cultivated, this is low, this is excellent, and this is the path and the way that leads to the cessation of this suffering.’

original: ‘Idaṁ sāvajjaṁ idaṁ anavajjaṁ, idaṁ sevitabbaṁ idaṁ na sevitabbaṁ, idaṁ hīnaṁ idaṁ paṇītaṁ, idaṁ kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgan’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.🔽Tassa evaṁ jānato evaṁ passato avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjati.
analyzed: idam sāvajjam idam anavajje idam sevitabbam idam na sevitabbe idam hīnam idam paṇīte idam kaṇha sukka sappaṭibhāgam ti yathābhūtam pajānāti  tassa evam jānataḥ evam passataḥ avijjā pahīyati vijjā uppajjati
translated: When he knows and sees thus, his mind is liberated from the taint of sensual desire, from the taint of being, and from the taint of ignorance.

original: Tassa avijjāvirāgā vijjuppādā uppajjati sukhaṁ, sukhā bhiyyo somanassaṁ.
analyzed: tassa avijjā avirāgā vijjuppādā uppajjati sukha sukhā bhiyyo somanassa
translated: When it is liberated there comes the knowledge: ‘It is liberated.’ He understands: ‘Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.’

original: Seyyathāpi, bho, pamudā pāmojjaṁ jāyetha;🔽evameva kho, bho, avijjāvirāgā vijjuppādā uppajjati sukhaṁ, sukhā bhiyyo somanassaṁ.
analyzed: sā iyyathā api bho pamudā pāmojjam jāyetha  evam eva kho bho avijjā virāgā vijjuppādā uppajjati sukha sukhā bhiyyas somanassa
translated: Just as if a man should build a staircase at the gate of a city,🔽so that it would be possible to climb up from the outside to the top of the wall and then to jump down on the other side inside the city,🔽so too, Master Gotama, has the Dhamma been taught by Master Gotama in such a way that it is possible to climb up from the outside to the top of the wall and then to jump down on the other side inside the city.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bho, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena tatiyo okāsādhigamo anubuddho sukhassādhigamāya.
analyzed: ayam kho bho tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena tatiyaḥ okāsa adhigamaḥ anubuddhaḥ sukhassa adhigamāya
translated: This, Master Gotama, is the third case in which Master Gotama’s dispensation is similar to a great ocean, which the brahmins praise in the verses they have composed.

original: Ime kho, bho, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena tayo okāsādhigamā anubuddhā sukhassādhigamāyā”ti.🔽Imamatthaṁ, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro bhāsittha,
analyzed: ime kho bho tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena tayo okāsa adhigamā anubuddhā sukhassa adhigamāya ati  imam attha bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ bhāsittha
translated: These are the three occasions for the attainment of pleasure that have been understood by the Blessed One who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened.”🔽This is the meaning of what the Brahmā Sahampati said.

original: imamatthaṁ, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro bhāsitvā deve tāvatiṁse āmantesi:
analyzed: imam attha bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ bhāsitvā deve tāvatise āmantesi
translated: Having said this, the Brahmā Sahampati,

original: 8. Catusatipaṭṭhāna
analyzed: catusati paṭṭhāna
translated: The Four Establishments of Mindfulness

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññanti, bhonto devā tāvatiṁsā, yāva supaññattā cime tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena cattāro satipaṭṭhānā paññattā kusalassādhigamāya.
analyzed: tam kim maññanti bhonto devā tāvatisā yāva su paññattā cime tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena cattāro sati paṭṭhānā paññattā kusalassa adhigamāya
translated: “What do you think, dear Sirs, the devas of the Tavatimsa realm? How well has the four establishments of mindfulness been taught by the Blessed One who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened, for the attainment of that pleasure?

original: Katame cattāro?🔽Idha, bho, bhikkhu ajjhattaṁ kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
analyzed: katame cattāro  idha bho bhikkhu ajjhattam kāye kāya anupassī viharati ātāpī sampajānaḥ satimā vineyya loke abhijjhā domanassa
translated: What are the four?

original: Ajjhattaṁ kāye kāyānupassī viharanto tattha sammā samādhiyati, sammā vippasīdati.
analyzed: ajjhattam kāye kāya anupassī viharantaḥ tattha sammā samādhiyati sammā vippasīdati
translated: Here, dear Sirs, a monk, having gone to the forest, to the foot of a tree, or to an empty place, sits down. Having folded his legs crosswise, straightened his body, and set up mindfulness in front of him, just mindful he breathes in and mindful he breathes out.🔽While he is breathing in a long breath, he knows “I am breathing in a long breath”; or, while he is breathing out a long breath, he knows “I am breathing out a long breath.”

original: So tattha sammā samāhito sammā vippasanno bahiddhā parakāye ñāṇadassanaṁ abhinibbatteti.
analyzed: so tattha sammā samāhitaḥ sammā vippasannaḥ bahiddhā parakāye ñāṇa dassanam abhinibbattā iti
translated: and having done so, he produces the knowledge and vision appropriate to that state.🔽He abides contemplating mind as mind internally, contemplating mind as mind externally, contemplating mind as mind both internally and externally.

original: Ajjhattaṁ vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati …pe…
analyzed: ajjhattam vedanāsu vedanā anupassī viharati pe
translated: He abides contemplating in mind its arising factors, contemplating in mind its vanishing factors, or contemplating in mind both its arising and vanishing factors.🔽Or his mindfulness that ‘there is mind’ is maintained to the extent necessary for bare knowledge and mindfulness.

original: bahiddhā paravedanāsu ñāṇadassanaṁ abhinibbatteti.
analyzed: bahiddhā para vedanāsu ñāṇa dassanam abhinibbattā iti
translated: He abides independent, not clinging to anything in the world.🔽And that, monks, is how a monk develops mindfulness of the mind.

original: Ajjhattaṁ citte cittānupassī viharati …pe…🔽bahiddhā paracitte ñāṇadassanaṁ abhinibbatteti.
analyzed: ajjhattam citte citta anupassī viharati pe  bahiddhā para citte ñāṇa dassanam abhinibbattā iti
translated: “And how, monks, does a monk develop mindfulness of dhammas?

original: Ajjhattaṁ dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
analyzed: ajjhattam dhammesu dhamma anupassī viharati ātāpī sampajānaḥ satimā vineyya loke abhijjhā domanassa
translated: Here, monks, a monk abides contemplating dhammas as dhammas, ardent, clearly aware and mindful, having put away covetousness and grief for the world.

original: Ajjhattaṁ dhammesu dhammānupassī viharanto tattha sammā samādhiyati, sammā vippasīdati.
analyzed: ajjhattam dhammesu dhamma anupassī viharantaḥ tattha sammā samādhiyati sammā vippasīdati
translated: And how, monks, does a monk abide contemplating dhammas as dhammas?

original: So tattha sammā samāhito sammā vippasanno bahiddhā paradhammesu ñāṇadassanaṁ abhinibbatteti.
analyzed: so tattha sammā samāhitaḥ sammā vippasannaḥ bahiddhā para dhammesu ñāṇa dassanam abhinibbattā iti
translated: Here, monks, a monk abides contemplating the five hindrances in the mind, ardent, clearly aware and mindful, having put away covetousness and grief for the world.

original: Ime kho, bho, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena cattāro satipaṭṭhānā paññattā kusalassādhigamāyā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho bho tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena cattāro sati paṭṭhānā paññattā kusalassa adhigamāya ati
translated: These, monks, are the four foundations of mindfulness that have been taught by me after I realised them for the benefit of guiding disciples who have entered upon the way.”🔽“And how, Reverend Gotama, does a monk develop mindfulness of the body?

original: Imamatthaṁ, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro bhāsittha.
analyzed: imam attha bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ bhāsittha
translated: This is the meaning of what was said in brief by the Blessed One when he spoke thus.

original: Imamatthaṁ, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro bhāsitvā deve tāvatiṁse āmantesi:
analyzed: imam attha bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ bhāsitvā deve tāvatise āmantesi
translated: Having said this, the brahma Sanankumara addressed the devas of the Thirty-three thus:

original: 9. Sattasamādhiparikkhāra🔽“Taṁ kiṁ maññanti, bhonto devā tāvatiṁsā, yāva supaññattā cime tena bhagavatā jānatā
analyzed: satta samādhi parikkhāra  tam kim maññanti bhonto devā tāvatisā yāva su paññattā cime tena bhagavatā jānatā
translated: The Seven Factors of Awakening

original: passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena satta samādhiparikkhārā sammāsamādhissa paribhāvanāya🔽sammāsamādhissa pāripūriyā.
analyzed: passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena satta samādhi parikkhārā sammā samādhissa paribhāvanāya  sammāsamādhissa pāripūriyā
translated: “What do the venerable ones think? Since these seven factors of awakening have been well expounded by the Blessed One who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened, for developing and accomplishing right concentration,

original: Katame satta?
analyzed: katame satta
translated: what seven?

original: Sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākammanto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati.
analyzed: sammā diṭṭhi sammā saṅkappo sammā vācā sammā kammanto sammā ājīvaḥ sammā vāyāmaḥ sammā sati
translated: Right view, right intention, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, and right mindfulness.🔽“Friends, the one-pointedness of mind that has been developed and matured by these seven factors comes to have a footing, comes to have a basis.

original: Yā kho, bho, imehi sattahaṅgehi cittassa ekaggatā parikkhatā, ayaṁ vuccati, bho, ariyo sammāsamādhi saupaniso itipi saparikkhāro itipi.
analyzed: yā kho bho imehi satta haṅgehi cittassa ekagga tā parikkhatā ayam vuccati bho ariyo sammāsamādhi sa upanisaḥ iti pi sa parikkhāraḥ iti pi
translated: This, friends, is called noble right concentration with its supports and its requisites.

original: Sammādiṭṭhissa, bho, sammāsaṅkappo pahoti, sammāsaṅkappassa sammāvācā pahoti, sammāvācassa
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhissa bho sammā saṅkappaḥ pahoti sammā saṅkappassa sammā vācā pahoti sammāvācassa
translated: Right intention is dependent on right view, right speech is dependent on right intention, right action is dependent on right speech,

original: sammākammanto pahoti. Sammākammantassa sammāājīvo pahoti, sammāājīvassa sammāvāyāmo
analyzed: sammā kammanto pahoti sammā kammantassa sammā ājīvaḥ pahoti sammā ājīvassa sammā vāyāmaḥ
translated: right action is possible. Right livelihood is possible for one of right action,🔽right effort is possible for one of right livelihood,

original: pahoti, sammāvāyāmassa sammāsati pahoti, sammāsatissa sammāsamādhi pahoti, sammāsamādhissa
analyzed: pahoti sammāvāyāmassa sammā sati pahoti sammā satissa sammā samādhi pahoti sammā samādhissa
translated: right mindfulness is possible for one of right effort, right concentration is possible for one of right mindfulness,🔽right knowledge is possible for one of right concentration,

original: sammāñāṇaṁ pahoti, sammāñāṇassa sammāvimutti pahoti.
analyzed: sammāñāṇam pahoti sammāñāṇassa sammāvimutti pahoti
translated: right freedom is possible for one of right knowledge.

original: Yañhi taṁ, bho, sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: yat hi ta bho sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: If anyone were to say rightly:

original: ‘svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhi apārutā amatassa dvārā’ti idameva taṁ sammā vadamāno vadeyya.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammaḥ sandiṭṭhikaḥ akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi a pārutā amatassa dvārā ti idam eva tam sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: ‘The Dhamma is well-proclaimed by the Lord, visible here and now, timeless, inviting inspection, leading onward, to be comprehended by the wise each one for himself,’🔽he would be saying rightly, not wrongly, and I could not reasonably be blamed for this.

original: Svākkhāto hi, bho, bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko, akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhi apārutā amatassa dvārā.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ hi bho bhagavatā dhammaḥ sandiṭṭhikaḥ akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi a pārutā amatassa dvārā
translated: For the Dhamma is well-proclaimed by the Lord, visible here and now, timeless, inviting inspection, leading onward, to be comprehended by the wise each one for himself.

original: Ye hi keci, bho, buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgatā, dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgatā,
analyzed: ye hi keci bho buddhe avecca ppasādena samannāgatāḥ dhamme avecca ppasādena samannāgatā
translated: And those who have full confidence in the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha,

original: saṅghe aveccappasādena samannāgatā, ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgatā, ye cime opapātikā
analyzed: saṅghe avecca ppasādena samannāgatāḥ ariya kantehi sīlehi samannāgatāḥ ye ca ime opapātikā
translated: and who have perfect confidence in the Sangha, and who have virtue that is dear to the noble ones, and who have attained to view, and who have attained to the right way, and who have attained to knowledge, and who have attained to enlightenment, and who are stream-enterers, no longer subject to falling , and are fixed in destiny and bound for enlightenment.

original: dhammavinītā sātirekāni catuvīsatisatasahassāni māgadhakā paricārakā abbhatītā kālaṅkatā
analyzed: dhamma vinītā sa atirekāni catuvīsati sata sahassāni māgadhakā paricārakā abbhatītā kālaṅkatā
translated: There are more than two hundred and fifty thousand Magadhan lay followers who have passed away

original: tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā sotāpannā avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā.
analyzed: tiṇṇam sayojanānam parikkhayā sotāpannā a vinipāta dhammā niyatā sambodhi parāyaṇā
translated: having abandoned three fetters, who are stream-enterers, no longer subject to falling , and are fixed in destiny and bound for enlightenment.

original: Atthi cevettha sakadāgāmino.🔽Atthāyaṁ itarā pajā,
analyzed: atthi ca iva ettha sakadāgāminaḥ  attha ayam itarā pajā
translated: But there are also once-returners here.🔽“This people is for the sake of merit,

original: puññābhāgāti me mano;
analyzed: puññābhāgā ati me mano
translated: my mind thinks,

original: Saṅkhātuṁ nopi sakkomi,
analyzed: saṅkhātum na upi sakkomi
translated: I cannot even calculate them,

original: musāvādassa ottappan”ti.
analyzed: musāvādassa ottappanti
translated: I am afraid of lying.”

original: Imamatthaṁ, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro bhāsittha, imamatthaṁ, bhante, brahmuno sanaṅkumārassa bhāsato vessavaṇassa mahārājassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
analyzed: imam attha bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ bhāsittha imam attha bhante brahmunaḥ sanaṅkumārassa bhāsataḥ vessavaṇassa mahā rājassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: “Sir, this is the issue that Brahmā Sahampati spoke about. And while Brahmā Sahampati was speaking about this issue, this thought arose in the mind of the great king Vessavaṇa:

original: “acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, evarūpopi nāma uḷāro satthā bhavissati, evarūpaṁ uḷāraṁ dhammakkhānaṁ, evarūpā uḷārā visesādhigamā paññāyissantī”ti.
analyzed: acchariyam vata bho abbhutam vata bho evarūpaḥ api nāma uḷāraḥ satthā bhavissati evarūpam uḷāram dhammakkhāne evarūpāḥ uḷārāḥ visesa adhigamāḥ paññāyissanti iti
translated: ‘How amazing! How astounding! Such a great teacher will appear, such a great teaching of the Dhamma, such great attainments will be known!’”

original: Atha, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro vessavaṇassa mahārājassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya vessavaṇaṁ mahārājānaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ vessavaṇassa mahā rājassa cetasā cetaḥ pari vitakkam aññāya vessavaṇam mahā rājānam etat avoca
translated: Then, venerable sir, Brahma Sanankumara, having known with his awareness the train of thought in the mind of the Great Brahma Vessavana, said to him:

original: “taṁ kiṁ maññati bhavaṁ vessavaṇo mahārājā atītampi addhānaṁ evarūpo uḷāro satthā ahosi, evarūpaṁ uḷāraṁ dhammakkhānaṁ, evarūpā uḷārā visesādhigamā paññāyiṁsu.
analyzed: tam kim maññati bhavam vessavaṇaḥ mahā rājā atītam pi addhānam evarūpaḥ uḷāraḥ satthā ahosi evarūpam uḷāram dhammakkhāne evarūpāḥ uḷārāḥ visesa adhigamāḥ paññāyisu
translated: ‘What does the venerable Vessavana think? In the past too there was such a lofty teacher, such a lofty exposition of the Dhamma, such a lofty attainment of the fruits of spiritual practice.

original: Anāgatampi addhānaṁ evarūpo uḷāro satthā bhavissati, evarūpaṁ uḷāraṁ dhammakkhānaṁ, evarūpā uḷārā visesādhigamā paññāyissantī”ti.🔽Imamatthaṁ, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro devānaṁ tāvatiṁsānaṁ abhāsi, imamatthaṁ vessavaṇo
analyzed: anāgatam pi addhānam evarūpaḥ uḷāraḥ satthā bhavissati evarūpam uḷāram dhammakkhāne evarūpāḥ uḷārāḥ visesa adhigamāḥ paññāyissanti iti  imam attha bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ devānam abhāsi imam attham vessavaṇaḥ
translated: In the future too there will be such a lofty teacher, such a lofty exposition of the Dhamma, such a lofty attainment of the fruits of spiritual practice.’

original: mahārājā brahmuno sanaṅkumārassa devānaṁ tāvatiṁsānaṁ bhāsato sammukhā sutaṁ sammukhā
analyzed: mahā rājā brahmunaḥ sanaṅkumārassa devānam bhāsato sammukhā sutam sammukhā
translated: ‘Venerable sir, this is the meaning the Great Brahma Vessavana spoke of in the presence of the Thirty-Three Gods, and this is the meaning the Great Brahma Vessavana, having heard in the presence of the Thirty-Three Gods,

original: paṭiggahitaṁ sayaṁ parisāyaṁ ārocesi’”.
analyzed: paṭiggahitam sayam parisāyam ārocesi
translated: having accepted it in the presence of the Thirty-Three Gods, declared to his own assembly.’

original: Imamatthaṁ janavasabho yakkho vessavaṇassa mahārājassa sayaṁ parisāyaṁ bhāsato sammukhā sutaṁ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṁ bhagavato ārocesi.
analyzed: imam attham janavasabhaḥ yakkhaḥ vessavaṇassa mahā rājassa sayam parisāyam bhāsataḥ sammukhā sutam sammukhā paṭiggahitam bhagavataḥ ārocesi
translated: The spirit Janavasabha, having heard and received this declaration of the Great King Vessavana in his own assembly, declared it to the Blessed One.

original: Imamatthaṁ bhagavā janavasabhassa yakkhassa sammukhā sutvā sammukhā paṭiggahetvā
analyzed: imam attham bhagavā janavasabhassa yakkhassa sammukhā sutvā sammukhā paṭiggahetvā
translated: Having heard and received this declaration of the spirit Janavasabha,

original: sāmañca abhiññāya āyasmato ānandassa ārocesi, imamatthamāyasmā ānando bhagavato sammukhā
analyzed: sāmañca abhiññāya āyasmato ānandassa ārocesi imam attham āyasmato ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ sammukhā
translated: the Blessed One, by his own supernormal knowledge, declared it to the venerable Ananda, and the venerable Ananda, having heard it

original: sutvā sammukhā paṭiggahetvā ārocesi bhikkhūnaṁ bhikkhunīnaṁ upāsakānaṁ upāsikānaṁ.
analyzed: sutvā sammukhā paṭiggahetvā ārocesi bhikkhūnam bhikkhunīnam upāsakānam upāsikāna
translated: from the Blessed One, declared it to the bhikkhus, bhikkhunis, male lay followers, and female lay followers.

original: Tayidaṁ brahmacariyaṁ iddhañceva phītañca vitthārikaṁ bāhujaññaṁ puthubhūtaṁ yāva devamanussehi suppakāsitanti.
analyzed: tayā idam brahmacariyam iddham ca iva phītam ca vitthārikam bāhujaññam puthu bhūtam yāva deva manussehi suppakāsitanti
translated: Thus this spiritual life has become prosperous, flourishing, far-renowned, and popular, and it has been spread far and wide among the people.

original: Janavasabhasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: janavasabha suttam niṭṭhitam pañcama
translated: The fifth sutta is finished.
